TF027127-PHRD-AGRICULTURE SECTOR
            ADJUSTMENT OPERATION,TF029306-PHRD - AGRICULTURE SECTOR
            ADJUSTMENT LOAN (ASAL),TF029481-PHRD-AGRICULTURAL INPUT
            GUARANTEE FACILITY

abstracts.cdata!:
The overall outcome of the Agricultural
            Sector Adjustment Loan Project is rated as "marginally
            unsatisfactory." The lessons learned from this project
            include: 1) Successive single tranche operations would have
            been preferable to one comprehensive two-tranche operation.
            It would have avoided the need for the very difficult
            decisions required as each new closure date loomed, on
            whether partial implementation progress justified extension
            or cancellation. 2) Generating early positive results are
            necessary for political sustainability. This requires early
            attention to measures aimed at building supportive laws and
            organizations that improve market responses to reform. 3)
            Generating early, positive results also requires rapid,
            efficient implementation. 4) The Ministry of Agriculture and
            Food saw this project as all pain and no gain. Adjustment
            loans bring foreign exchange to the Ministry of Finance, but
            typically bring little in the way of tangible support to
            line ministries. 5) The Romania Agricultural Sector
            Adjustment Loan Project, at $350 million, was too large. The
            loan was excessive in relation to the conditions and to the
            economic importance of the agriculture sector. It induced a
            strong effort to obtain tranche release without any
            compensating increase in genuine commitment to reform
            through a steady and sustained effort.
